evidence_items.text: A tug driving instructor (tug instructor) and trainee tug driver (trainee driver) were seated beside each other in the tug. The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so. The headset operator continued walking on the right side of the tug, abeam its cabin. The wingman was on the left just ahead of the tug.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

roots_spec.exclusion_clause: Not explained by any other root

slot_statements.availability: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew was present and observable during the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA incident on 12-25, as documented in the historical dynamic understanding preliminary data.
slot_statements.defeater_resistance: The explanation of communication/coordination breakdown among crew resists defeaters by accounting for alternative causes and is supported by consistent evidence from the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA 12-25 preliminary data.
slot_statements.fit_to_key_features: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew aligns with key features identified in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA 12-25 incident, including miscommunication, delayed responses, and coordination lapses.

node.statement: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew was present and observable during the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA incident on 12-25, as documented in the historical dynamic understanding preliminary data.

assumptions: Communication between flight crew and tug operators via interphone implies active coordination.
The pushback continuation after seat swap and subsequent collision indicates coordination failure.
defeaters: If evidence showed clear, effective communication and coordination without errors or deviations.
If the incident was solely due to procedural deviation unrelated to communication breakdown.

quotes.exact_quote: The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Evidence H1-H4 documents communication among crew and tug operators and observable coordination issues during pushback, supporting the presence of communication/coordination breakdown (R2_COMMUNICATION_BREAKDOWN).
outcome.uncertainty_source: ambiguity in distinguishing communication breakdown from procedural deviation without further detailed behavioral data

slot_statements.availability: The environmental or marking deficiency must be present and identifiable within the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA aircraft during the historical dynamic under preliminary conditions at time t0 on 12-25.
slot_statements.defeater_resistance: The identification of the environmental or marking deficiency must be robust against potential defeaters or counter-evidence within the context of the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA aircraft's historical dynamic preliminary conditions at time t0 on 12-25.
slot_statements.fit_to_key_features: The environmental or marking deficiency should align with the key features and characteristics defined for the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA aircraft under the specified historical dynamic preliminary conditions at time t0 on 12-25.

node.statement: The environmental or marking deficiency must be present and identifiable within the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA aircraft during the historical dynamic under preliminary conditions at time t0 on 12-25.

defeaters: If evidence showed the TRP markings were obscured or not visible at time t0, or if crew reported confusion about markings, the conclusion might change.

quotes.exact_quote: The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Evidence H4 shows the aircraft passed the TRP marking and hit a barrier, indicating no marking deficiency. H2 and H3 show procedural actions by tug operators, supporting procedural deviation over marking deficiency. Discriminators favor procedural deviation over environmental deficiency.

The pushback continuation after seat swap and subsequent collision indicates coordination failure.

If the incident was solely due to procedural deviation unrelated to communication breakdown.
